clinical_study.brief_title: Neuromuscular and Cognitive Fatigue During a 24 Hour Treadmill Running Exercise
clinical_study.official_title: Neuromuscular and Cognitive Fatigue During a 24h Treadmill Running Exercise.

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of the present study is to determine the relative contributions of central and peripheral fatigue during an ultra-endurance exercise.

detailed_description.textblock: For that purpose, 14 subjects running 24 hours on a treadmill will be compared with a control group being awake during the same period. Subjects who running will have electrically evoked forces on the muscles associated EMG activity, blood samples and muscle biopsy.

primary_outcome.measure: -Voluntary and electrically evoked forces on the contracted muscles

secondary_outcome.measure: Electrically evoked forces on the relaxed muscles and associated EMG activity

arm_group.description: patients running during 24 hours without sleep

intervention.description: patients running during 24 hours without sleep

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The subjects of the experimental group will be recruited among experienced ultra-runners . They all have run at least a 12 hour race or longer.
- The control group will be recruited among experienced ultra-runners . Age of control group will be age experimental group more or less 2 years.
Exclusion Criteria:
- The subjects will not be selected if:
- they were injured in the 3 months before the experiment
- they had a tendon or joint pathology that could impair strength measurements.
- they participate to an other experiment at the same time
